Sentencas: In this paper, the structural and electronic properties of CeO2 are studied using conventional and hybrid density functional theory.
Titulo: Modeling basic components of solid oxide fuel cells using density functional theory: Bulk and surface properties of CeO2

Sentencas: A computational protocol, based on the parameter-free hybrid functional PBE0 coupled with a 4f in-valence basis set for Ce atoms based on a 28 electrons small core pseudopotential is able to reasonably reproduce both structural and electronic experimental data.
Titulo: Modeling basic components of solid oxide fuel cells using density functional theory: Bulk and surface properties of CeO2

Sentencas: Such a protocol is then applied to the modeling of true 2-D periodic CeO2 slabs of non polar low-index surfaces.
Titulo: Modeling basic components of solid oxide fuel cells using density functional theory: Bulk and surface properties of CeO2

Sentencas: The obtained results show that the (111) surface is more stable than the (110) one (0.73 vs 0.81 J/m(2)), with a substantial rumbling in the outermost planes of this latter.
Titulo: Modeling basic components of solid oxide fuel cells using density functional theory: Bulk and surface properties of CeO2

Sentencas: Finally, as a first step toward reactivity at CeO2 surfaces involved in solid oxide fuel cells, the importance of electrostatic effects in the adsorption of chemical species such as CO is presented.
Titulo: Modeling basic components of solid oxide fuel cells using density functional theory: Bulk and surface properties of CeO2

Sentencas: These results will allow for a detailed study of catalytic reactions at ceria surface.
Titulo: Modeling basic components of solid oxide fuel cells using density functional theory: Bulk and surface properties of CeO2
